question: An artificial barrier made from improvised materials, used during uprisings
An official organization in the Roman Catholic Church whose purpose was to find and punish people who opposed its beliefs
The cutting of or operation on a living animal usually for physiological or pathological investigation.
A strong, regular repeated pattern of movement or sound.
A continuous moving strip or surface that is used for transporting objects from one place to another
To speak very quietly, using the breath but not the voice
A set of mathematical instructions or rules that, especially if given to a computer, will help to calculate an answer to a problem:
The quality of existing as or representing an idea, a feeling, etc. and not a material object, or something that has this quality
The ability of different objects to be accessed through the same interface, allowing a single function or method to operate on different types in a unified way
The giving out of light by a substance that has not been heated
